channel.title: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
channel.description:
whonix 14, testing repos , standealoneVM, after last pushed upgrades this message appeared:
- Issue Specific log
```` Processing triggers for qubes-whonix (1:9.8-1) ... OK: Loading Whonix firewall... OK: Skipping firewall mode detection since already set to 'full'. OK: (Full torified network access allowed.) iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded. item.title: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
didnt show up in the templates upgrades , but only inside a standaloneVM based on whonix.

if you mean standaloneVM as GW , yes it happened in both GW & WS.

Read full topic
item.source: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.

item.title: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did this happen during apt-get dist-upgrade inside sys-whonix?

Read full topic
item.source: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.

item.title: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Confirmed. Saw this on myself before. apt-get is somehow sandboxed since Debian stretch. iptables rules can no longer be changed during apt-get upgrades. In result, if Whonix firewall iptables rules were to change, which they did not, reboot would be required.

So for now it can be safely ignored.

Read full topic
item.source: iptables v1.6.0: can't initialize iptables table `filter': Permission denied (you must be root) Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
